instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello,

That board is missing the CPU power rail but it is in an S0 state.
The <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> signal is on at 3.3V

Corrosion was worth between <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C2411</CAPACITOR>, on the probe point, rail <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCDMI_FDI</SIGNAL>
This rail is at 0V.
That rail comes from <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> which is present at 1.05V

Probe point is gone and I try to dig a small hole to attach a wire and reconnect it to the resistor and capacitor.
It seems that I did it but still no CPU rail.

I've replaced since <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> as well as <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> but no cigar.

One more thing... <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.4V but SMC is on. Is that normal on the board?

Thanks!

threads.message: Well that is a problem, find the broken trace..
